intro: Leonurus altissimus, commonly known as greater betony, is a flowering plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant is native to Europe, western Asia, and parts of North Africa. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Leonurus altissimus has been historically used in traditional medicine for its purported calming and healing properties.
